intro: Kuhnia baccharoides, commonly known as the desert reed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in desert or semi-desert environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, usually blooming in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. Kuhnia baccharoides is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
